result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:38 PM Cased called - 22CF27, 22TR272, 22TR273.  Mr. Greger previously appeared was informed of charges.  Attorney Petersen asks for return on 10/18.  Mr. Greger may appear by zoom or appear in person on 10/18.  Mr. Greger to report to the PCSD for fingerprinting.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Ordered that Attorney Melissa Petersen is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 10-01-2022, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.  See Order

1:37 PM Defendant Caleb Dean Greger in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by zoom technology by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and rights. Court understands you didn't qualify for a PD and ask we appoint an attorney.  You will have to repay the County of Pepin.  Court appoints Attorney Melissa Peterson.  You will need to pay $100/mo. for her services com. 10/1.  Cases #22TR272 & 22TR273 will track along.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
